title: New Zealand will not relish prospect of playing Ireland, says Andy Farrell
text:
Andy Farrell says the All Blacks will certainly not relish playing Ireland in the quarter-finals of the Rugby World Cup in Tokyo next weekend.

New Zealand may be the world’s No1 ranked team; the back-to-back world champions. They may be odds-on to make it a hat-trick of titles in three weeks’ time. But Ireland have beaten them twice in their last three encounters.

And Farrell is not alone in thinking that that fact may be at the back of their minds before their meeting at the Tokyo International Stadium on Saturday.

Ireland must face Steve Hansen’s team after Japan came through a dramatic test against Scotland in Yokohama to qualify as Pool A winners.

But Farrell, who takes over from Joe Schmidt...
description: Andy Farrell says the All Blacks will certainly not relish playing Ireland in the quarter-finals of the Rugby World Cup in Tokyo next weekend.
